tweet_text: Giants-Cowboys Thanksgiving Day game on FOX averaged 42 million viewers across TV and digital, making it the most-watched NFL regular-season game on record.

Bills' LB Von Miller did not tear his ACL, but there is other damage that doctors are reviewing to determine how much time he will miss and for now he is out indefinitely, per sources. He could be out a couple of weeks, it could be season ending; more info still being gathered.

New Twitter policy is freedom of speech, but not freedom of reach.Negative/hate tweets will be max deboosted & demonetized, so no ads or other revenue to Twitter. You wont find the tweet unless you specifically seek it out, which is no different from rest of Internet.
Should Twitter offer a general amnesty to suspended accounts, provided that they have not broken the law or engaged in egregious spam?
You might notice small, sometimes major, improvements in speed of Twitter. Will be especially significant in countries far away from USA.

Should be 'included in', not 'included on', of course, but I bet even professional proof readers miss stuff when they're seriously pissed off.

You can get ahead in life and still be kind. Be a fighter without being a bully. Swim without being a shark. Be vulnerable and still be strong. Step up without stepping on and over others. You can live with love for self and others.

If you constantly give of yourself and are repeatedly taken advantage of, the burden lies on your shoulders to create boundaries and stick to them. Its far more difficult than it seems but also extremely rewarding in gaining quality of life.
Summon the courage to tell someone you love, that you love them. Then, go a step further and tell them why you love them.
We have little control over how much others care for us. We have much more control about how much we care for ourselves and others.
When in a difficult situation that cant be changed, change your attitude towards the situation. It might be far fetched enough to help.

If you're feeling tired or weak on this Monday, here's a reminder that God is right by your side, and He will complete what He has started in your life.
Our aim as Christians is to make the name of Jesus known, not our own name!We live with excellence not to show how wonderful we are but to proclaim the goodness of God.

In this life, we will suffer, just like Christ. He was tempted and tried, just like you and me. But many times, we dont find our deepest calling or purpose without suffering along the way. Jesus is our model for both passion and compassion despite life's circumstances!

You might not see the fruit of your labor right away. But keep being obedient to what God is calling you to do. Focus on your mission, and dont get carried away with the results. Those are best left in Gods hands!

Life is challenging. None of us are immune to tough times, seasons of doubt, or trials that seem like theyll never end. But we can still choose to believe that God will use our hardships for good, and turn our darkness into light.

Where focus goes, energy flows. And where energy flows, whatever you're focusing on grows. In other words, your life is controlled by what you focus on. That's why you need to focus on where you want to go, not on what you fear.

The three decisions that control your destiny are:1. Your decisions about what to focus on.2. Your decisions about what things mean to you.3. Your decisions about what to do to create the results you desire.

When it comes down to it, health is everything. Its the ultimate wealth that we all have in our lives! And as we age, it is possible to create the energy, strength, vitality, and purpose to live life to its fullest.

who we want to be, and how we can serve, and contribute.Focusing on that highest vision helps create energy and momentum. We can kick feelings of frustration or depression by changing the channel of our attention to how to help someone in need.

Most people focus on how to avoid pain in the short-term. If we want to push our life to the next level and experience fulfillment and true quality of life we need to be laser-focused on our ultimate vision and our sense of mission

I believe web3 is in the process of rebooting itself. NFT-wise, there will be reorgs and consolidations. From this will emerge new systems that reward artists, builders, and collectors -- but it's going to take time to build. I'm buckled up.

For years, the cryptopunks average sale price was sub $100. Then came the next wave: builders launched new marketplaces, novel drop mechanics, generative art, etc. -- and with that, fantastic contemporary artists flooded in -- we entered the bull. 1/3

This morning, Genesis, the lending platform powering Gemini Earn, announced that they have paused withdrawals. We're not fancy; we hold ETH in a SOC1/SOC2 compliant multi-sig custodial solution and USD in a top-tier financial institution. Zero funds lost, zero funds held back.

I never bet against technology and the inevitable. Equally important, great brands aren't built in 6-months, ours included, that's why we're heads down and building -- we're here for the long term.   3/3
Now, we're in another build cycle. Adoption and security will improve, new NFT mechanics around distribution, decentralization, and dynamic art will emerge, and NFTs will return with force. 2/3

Knowing Chadwick Boseman has always been about reveling in both the joy and the lessons in life, so today we celebrate #Juneteenth as a nation for the first time, making sure that we also understand its history.

Everyones traditions around this holiday may be different, but its vital that we continue to accurately acknowledge our past, celebrate present victories, and move forward in unity to build a better future.

This symbolic victory is a step in the right direction, but we have miles ahead of us as we continue to fight for equity, reparations and justice reform, and against voter suppression, food insecurity & the laundry list of issues that have debilitated our community for centuries.
